comments.body: To add insult to injury. My brother told me the render distance for iOS is 18 chunks. That right there tells me that the Xbox One S can very easily double that. I had absolutely zero trouble with performance when it was 22 chunks. 14 chunks is frankly insufficient for a pretty recent console like the Xbox One S.

They have taken great lengths to make sure no one can change the render distance. The TXT. options file, which is a file that used to allow you to set a custom render distance, has been disabled as of the update that reduced the render distance. To make it worse, all the feedback suggestions that get added or considered by the developers are 2 or 3 years old, which may mean we won't see it restored or fixed for 2 to 3 years. I greatly have a distaste for Mojang after this happened.

It is pretty crazy that it has been lowed to a little 14 chunks. Which used to be 22 and it used to function fine , my phone isn't that particularly powerful and it does 20. The Xbox one s can do it fine why is it being taken away. If it's some realms thing then why is it affecting normal game play. 95%+ of people never play realms I bet

My iPhone XR can do 32 Chunks which runs really smothly. Switch is running the game in 14 chunks which is not good I have heard so many times from various YouTubers that they choose bedrock because render distance and preformence is better. Then why my Xbox one s runs Minecraft 10 year old game the same as switch I mean I am a Java player but now I am far from home and my Xbox series x which I don’t now how far render distance goes there I assume 32 chunks but idk.and as I wanted to play the game on Xbox I can’t it’s nearly unplayable also I run the server which render is locked for every player to 10 and I play on shaders which is kinda self explanatory why only 10
But on fricking Xbox one………..ach man I’m so angry about this what next maybe set graphics to low and lock chunks only to 10
WHy do we have to suffer the pain of this utter mess
I realize this was pretty long but i wanted to give some context.

I totally agree. when they zoomed in on the village with the telescope, I just hated the black oval cut-out. I think the 3D model as it's being held is cool too. 

The telescope zoom should just be like an ordinary Optifine zoom except a hint of blurred magnification around the edges and some vignette action. And i think it should be either square, or a more pixelated circle. The pixels being so small doesn't match at all. 

If there is going to be a 3D model for it, the shape of the view should be the same shape as it is on the model.
Your request has been granted.
Or create separate grass blocks for each biome allowing the creation of artificial biomes.
I should not be boxy
Beacon effects are driving me crazy, I wish there was an option to switch these off. I'm assuming I'm not missing an option to do so on Bedrock?

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.
I agree! Rather than the usual swirly potion particles, entities under the Wither effect could produce falling, black dust particles!
I don't feel so good!
Or you could slowly disappear, pixel by pixel.........
But they don’t even drink anything...

This Genuinely should have been thought of first, along with lighting the area around you with torches. 

I was waiting for this update since my house uses a lot of stained glass only to be disappointed that it only had normal lighting.

I agree with this post. It's immersion breaking to not have the light be affected by stained glass. My cathedral build would appreciate it if the stained glass murals were affected by the lighting of vibrant visuals
yes yes (Make mobs throw back their head when their hit

391667892372

They don't really need a separate armor model for slim armed models (Skeletons don't have unique armor models, and it would be weird if they did. Same goes for slim arms... except it wouldn't be quite as weird).

Here's my reasoning: It would take a lot more effort to do this, and it would only be a single pixel difference (which on armor, is kinda redundant. They'd need to make Slim-Armed variants for every texture). And if someone with a Steve model wore the armor, then gave it to someone with an Alex model, then the armor would magically change sizes? (I know baby zombies change armor sizes, but it's a lot easier to give another player armor rather than a zombie).

I suppose one way they could do it would be to simply resize the armor a smidgen, but then the texture would be slightly distorted (although having slim variants of the textures could be potentially interesting when combined with resource packs)

But then what about armor stands? Would they use the slim models or the regular? :/

391667892372

Fair enough.

(But if all the models in Dungeons are slim armed, then it just the same thing, right?)
Assuming that the armor texture remains the same on mobs and as items, would the armor instead change to match the player's skin? How would you tell what kind of armor that player is wearing?
Most people don't like blinking skins, and they're just weird overall. I don't think this should happen, but if it does, there should be an option to turn it off.
It would not be possible since all the aspects that you download may or may not have eyes or have them somewhere else.

seria muito interessante se as guarnições de armadura trouxessem alguma vantagem, por exemplo:

As guarnições fabricadas com esmeralda podiam nos fornecer um desconto nas trocas com aldeões;

As fabricadas com ouro podiam fazer com que os piglins não nos atacassem;

As fabricadas com lápis-lazúli podiam nos dar maior chance de melhores encantamentos;

As fabricadas com redstone  podiam nos dar a habilidade de ativar sistemas de redstone sem usar uma alavanca, um botão...;

Entre outras vantagens.

Maybe just have one big texture as a lookup table, where each pixel represent one of the previously hardcoaded colours? It dosnt need to be anything fancy.
Years later and I'm still mad about this. The swamp is so ugly, why not let us change all biomes with the biome color map...
Redstone, potion colors, sheep/banner/armor colors, new biomes. We can change some of the grass but NONE of the water! Even stuff like the vine and lilypad items! Why?
It would also be nice for making custom skins.

I agree, it would be neat to see new animations using knees and elbows on players and other mobs/animals. Perhaps there would be some new and unique animations for fishing, pulling back bows, riding a horse, and so on.
